job_title: Associate Director of Development in Mentor, OH
pros: I've been with Crossroads Health for about 3.5 years and I can honestly say they have been the best 3.5 years with regards to my work life. I came from over 25 years in the customer service industry and will be forever grateful that I was hired with this organization and given the opportunity for an amazing career change! From the CEO down-I have always felt supported and that speaks volumes to me. I don't feel like I am just another employee. I feel appreciated and valued. One of the other huge things about this organization is the flexibility of my schedule and I have a wonderful work/life balance. Everyone on my team and so many other teams are some of the most sincere and caring individuals I've ever met. I am blessed to work here to say the least!
cons: I do not have any cons about working for Crossroads Health. It is a rapidly growing organization that is making a huge positive impact on our community and I wake up with gratitude every day knowing that I get to be a part of that impact!

pros: Flexibility, PTO, colleagues, support from colleagues - not management
cons: As of recent everything. There was a comment that cuts needed to be made, but the fact is that people are constantly in a state of panic and if they will have a job, staff continues to be overworked, and there are no incentives, or increases even projected to happen. Upper management is delusional at best about the "outlook" of the agency, and only seems to be worried about the bottom dollar since huge mistakes were made. They are not worried about solving the solution or taking cuts themselves, but rather cutting direct care professionals that actually bring profit in, not sitting in an office trying to figure out how to justify their decisions. If there wasn't four levels of management and supervisors then maybe there would actually be enough staff to see client's. I find it amusing at best that due to the negative reviews management is being encouraged to post positive reviews.
